data.title: EP12: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya by Anime Is For Jerks
data.meta_description:
In which Alex and Cass discuss The Tale of the Princess Kaguya, directed by Isao Takahata and produced by Studio Ghibli.
Next month we will be discussing The Tatami Galaxy, directed by Masaaki Yuasa and produced by Madhouse. 
Discussed: how to pronounce "Ghibli", what you would do if you found a tiny person in the woods, bamboo socialism, a range of chobe, being born a thousand years too early for the invention of hip-hop, a picture-perfect dickbutt, :3, eternal sunshine of the spotless mind, being both a liar and an asshole, the mysterious identity of this angry old woman, full holden caulfield mode, moon powers, cat face polearm, moon buddha, this movie is real fuckin' bleak y'all, the fact that we didn't talk about saṃsāra or nirvana at all in this episode is a tremendous failing that occurs to me only in retrospect, Big Bird In Japan, Big Bird In China
Cass's book recommendation: Ballad of the Whiskey Robber: A True Story of Bank Heists, Ice Hockey, Transylvanian Pelt Smuggling, Moonlighting Detectives, and Broken Hearts by Julian Rubinstein
Alex's book recommendation: The Corner That Held Them by Sylvia Townsend Warner
Social:
Show Twitter: @animeisforjerks
Show Mastodon: @animeisforjerks@skeleton.cool
Show Email: animeisforjerks@gmail.com
Cass's Twitter: @prophet_goddess
Cass's Mastodon: @prophet_goddess@skeleton.cool
Alex's Twitter: @dunndunndunn
Alex's Mastodon: @catalina@selfy.army
data.text:
In which Cass & Alex discuss Kaiba, directed by Masaaki Yuasa and produced by Madhouse.

Next month we will be discussing Only Yesterday, directed by Isao Takahata and produced by Studio Ghibli.

Discussed: this show sucks, midgar (i cut a tangent about barrett calling midgar a rotten pizza in the japanese version of ffvii, if you want that content go watch Let's Mosey: A Slow Translation of Final Fantasy VII by Tim Rogers) , the finger on the monkey's paw, bobs big boy burbank, mf said skonk, a graph theory themed fertility tattoo, extreme looney tunes shit, xkcd 483: Fiction Rule of Thumb, the second matrix sequel, the cursed horny, fucking yourself to death via inflation, fucking yourself to death being a crime, big titty goth gf memory smuggler, azumanga daioh, releasing your brain eggs into the hypersphere, a smoking baby in a tall robot, Just A Baby by Neil Cicierega, how penises work, hundreds of tiny robot dogs, t-posing to assert dominance, who in this show invests in crypto, bioshock infinite, "me: i am fundementally opposed to the monarchy and the church as ruling powers. history is a record of their atrocities" by @headfallsoff

FINAL SCORES:

Walking Around: 0/5

Fellowship: 0/5

Deliciousness: 0/5

Transcendence: 0/5

Goofing: 0/5

Amelioration: 0/5

Coitus: 0/5

Enthrallment: 0/5

Fuck You: 0/5

Eat Shit: 0/5

Alex's Book Recommendation: Here Comes the Sun by Nicole Dennis-Benn

Cass's Book Recommendation: Never Let Me Go by Kazuo Ishiguro

In which Cass & Alex discuss Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine, directed by Sayo Yamamoto and produced by TMS/Po10tial.

Next month we will be discussing Kaiba, directed by Masaaki Yuasa and produced by Madhouse.

Discussed: friend of the show takeshi koike, the sensuality of monkey punch, the dizzy dizzy drug, the giant buddha statue made out of drugs in the basement, the cat pronoun, that picture of john lennon, goemon baths, unmotivated camera movement, getting a real girlfriend, bees, magnum dong, crossdressing: it's free and the cops can't stop you, fiadel kestrel, antiques roadshow, @dril "THERAPIST: your problem is, that youre perfect, and everyone is jealous of your good posts, and that makes you rightfully upset. ME: I agree", lupin's interiority, doing a terrorist attack to get dick, one half of a split fucking second, withered wojack, three years of this podcast

FINAL SCORES:

Walking Around: 4/5

Fellowship: 2/5

Deliciousness: 1/5

Transcendence: 3/5

Goofing: 3/5

Coitus: 3/5

Enthrallment: 3/5

Owls: 5/5

In which Cass & Alex discuss Cowboy Bebop, directed by Shinichiro Watanabe and produced by Sunrise.

Next month we will be discussing Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine, directed by Sayo Yamamoto and produced by TMS/Po10tial.

Discussed: the netflix live action cowboy bebop, @TomatoGrandpa: "Reading the Bebop reviews and yea, this is exactly what I expected.", "Why Does Everyone In Netflix's Cowboy Bebop Talk Like That?" by Gita Jackson, @NotBrunoAgain: "This is bait but whatever: the truly stupid thing about this attitude is that there is a CEASELESS TORRENT OF GREAT ART you could be enjoying instead, more than you could ever possibly get to", relentless american cultural hegemony, "The Genius Design of Cowboy Bebop's Titles" by Linus Boman, "Martin Scorsese - The Art of Silence" by Every Frame A Painting, the knife's edge of being stupid, Dirt on the Camera Lens by Mike Rugnetta, faye's outfit, the conceptual definition of the himbo, the boob situation, the great gatsby, tokyo godfathers, The Gun That Makes You Old, touching computer, a gay alien, 17776 by Jon Bois, leaving things in the fridge, gender, star wars, spike's big coat, jet's cop outfit, what guys looked like in the 70s, beta and vhs, LET'S GO TO HELL!!!, the space shuttle columbia, a perfectly spherical dinner suit, the clown as the very image of christ, the young men's cowboy association, "A startup is pitching a mind-uploading service that is '100 percent fatal'", Marshall Banana, eating two dozen hard boiled eggs with your bro, the loser bar, Uzumaki, Dragon Quest XI: The Kotaku Review, ACTION BUTTON REVIEWS The Final Fantasy VII Remake

In which Cass & Alex discuss Mononoke, directed by Kenji Nakamura and produced by Toei Animation.

Next month we will be discussing Tokyo Godfathers, directed by Satoshi Kon and produced by Madhouse.

Discussed: pure vibes performance, being pressured to watch something for a podcast, a newgrounds meet 'n' fuck game, @mcclure111: "There are certain kinds of visual-- mostly things involving small dots, dithering, complex patterns-- that the video codecs we've adopted everywhere are just plain bad at representing. Without any conversation, we've culturally decided those types of art will simply not exist", "Why Snow and Confetti Ruin YouTube Video Quality" by Tom Scott, the mononoke wikipedia article, impossible geometry, being trapped in a room with a bunch of spirits who have strong feelings about abortion, giving birth to who knows how many ghosts, turning into dust, being cleansed of your sins by an evil cat, a weird fish with a shamisen, paul rudd's computer, boat ufos, who hasn't been dead the whole time, the interpretive equivalent of that bit from wallance and gromit where gromit is laying the train tracks down in front of him, a 30 episode shonen sports anime about the world of competitive incense smelling, the three japanese arts of refinement, genjiko, taikyoku shogi, swooping owl, cat sword, evil wolf, blind dog, flying horse, poisonous snake, wrestler, pig general, reverse chariot, mountain witch, gliding swallow, vertical horse, left dog, right dog, a piece of wood that grants you power, braktheman, the oldest elementary schooler in history of the world, more being worse when it comes to coitus, revisiting utena's (and our) problems with race, "Disturbing, Traversing, Borderless, Shaking Sexuality: The Place where Revolutionary Girl Utena was Born"

FINAL SCORES:

Walking Around: 2/5

Fellowship: 1/5

Deliciousness: 0/5

Transcendence: 5/5

Goofing: 2/5

Amelioration: 5/5

Coitus: 1/5

Enthrallment: 5/5

Next month we will be discussing Mononoke, directed by Kenji Nakamura and produced by Toei Animation.

Discussed: why we are watching this instead of tokyo godfathers, nausea of the soul, a movie about how you should stop watching anime, a glossy jpeg of paris tinted red, Michael Bay - What is Bayhem by Every Frame a Painting, おっぱいメガネ, chapter 5 of kentucky route zero, why there are brands after the apocalypse, i have nipples greg can you milk me, trying mindfulness, the hedgehog's dilemma, shinji's iconic walkman, a dad is a cop with laser eyes, demi adejuyigbe's ready player one theme song, dudes named ryoji, exposition, gyarus after the apocalypse, nice face for a clown, getting a haircut in a squash court, the chamber of guf, the thirteenth man-made ultimate multipurpose humanoid decisive weapon, using the key of nebuchadnezzar and abandoning your humanity, Heartbreaking: The Worst Person You Know Just Had A Great One-Liner, sunny-place, an eva that is both imaginary and fictional, Têtes à claques, man pain, being a wife guy to such a degree you have to destroy the world, being fine, destroying evangelion, touching grass

Next month we will be discussing Tokyo Godfathers, directed by Satoshi Kon and produced by Madhouse.

Discussed: job john, bathing is counterrevolutionary, chads on both sides, sitting in a dive bar drinking whiskey in a white linen suit for several months, donkey kong forward aerial, "witness the fate of a soldier!" i throw one leg out and fall on my ass. it's not clear what kind of move i was trying to do, naked snake, venom snake, someone finally bought a copy of your book, sir!, seaplane fishermen(?), flanagan boone and his mad angler squadron, the world being this awful forever, capybaras, my "they told me i'm physically healthy and mentally sound" t-shirt is raising a lot of questions already answered by my t-shirt, delicious juice, anomalously pointy teeth, shower with the lads simulator 2016: do you still shower with the lads, rick doms, fuckdads.com, getting zodiac'd, the aviator, show me all the gundams, char aznable steely dan amv, fancy baroque ladies, a big football with legs, A Planet For Texans, jerking off a weird crystal bong, adolf hitler, buttsham, tricorn hat, brain moment, the light of hatred, hitler and proud of it, gaslight, gatekeep, girlboss, the mask stays on during sex, the nine delights, estonian military rations

FINAL SCORES:

Deliciousness: 0/5
